title: Chapter 1: The People vs. Gov. Salazar
intro: judge: Court is now in session for the case of The People vs. Governor Salazar.
prosecutor: Your Honor, the prosecution accuses the defendant of embezzlement and bribery involving public infrastructure funds.
defense: The defense will demonstrate these claims are baseless and politically motivated.
you: (This will be your biggest case yet...)
goals: Secure a ruling of guilt or innocence.

evidence.name: Suspicious Email Chain
evidence.description: An internal email conversation between the governor's chief of staff and the contractor.

evidence.name: Inflated Invoice
evidence.description: A suspicious infrastructure project invoice worth ₱96 million.

evidence.name: Parking Lot Meeting Footage
evidence.description: Security footage of a late-night meeting between the governor and contractor.

dialogue: witness: I was asked to falsify budget reports. I refused. That's why I'm here.
prosecutor: The invoice was inflated. The email chain proves conspiracy.
defense: That invoice was generated by a contractor. The governor never approved it.
judge: Order! Submit your metadata analysis if you’re challenging evidence integrity.
you: Your Honor, I request a closer examination of the invoice timestamp and authorship.
